paper_abstract: A total coloring of a graph G is a coloring of the vertices and edges of G such that no adjacent vertices, no adjacent edges, and no edge and its end-vertices are assigned the same color. We say a graph G is subcubic, if G has maximum degree at most three. In this paper we provide a concise proof for total 5-coloring subcubic graphs. (C) 2013 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A concise proof for total coloring subcubic graphs
